1.text: Cut 2 pounds (0.91 kg) of squid into 1⁄8 inch (0.32 cm) thick rings.

2.text: Put the rings in a bowl and pour in 1⁄2 cup (120 ml) of buttermilk.

3.text: Pour 8 cups (1.9 L) of vegetable oil into a deep pot and heat it to 360 °F (182 °C).

4.text: Combine the flour and pepper in a separate bowl.

5.text: Toss the rings in the dry mixture.

6.text: Fry 1 batch of the rings for 1 minute.

7.text: Transfer the fried calamari to a wire rack and fry another batch.

8.text: Season the calamari with kosher salt and serve it with lemon wedges.

9.text: Mix the salt, oils, chilis, garlic, and scallions in a bowl.

10.text: Cut 3⁄4 pound (340 g) of squid into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thick rings.

11.text: Add the calamari to the bowl and marinate it for 5 to 10 minutes.

12.text: Sauté 1/2 of the calamari in a skillet over high for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes.

13.text: Transfer the calamari to a serving bowl and sauté the remaining rings.

14.text: Serve the sautéed calamari with scallions and your favorite sides.

16.text: Sauté the onion and garlic for 4 minutes over medium heat.

17.text: Slice 2 pounds (0.91 kg) of squid into 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) rings.

18.text: Add the calamari and 1⁄2 cup (120 ml) of dry white wine to the pan.

19.text: Simmer the calamari in wine for 3 minutes.

20.text: Crush the canned tomatoes and add them along with thyme and black olives.

21.text: Simmer the calamari for 30 minutes or until it's soft.

22.text: Remove the sprigs of thyme and add harissa and lemon zest.

23.text: Season the calamari with salt, pepper, and parsley before you serve it.

24.text: Mix the garlic, pepper flakes, parsley, oil, lemon juice, and salt in a bowl.

25.text: Add the calamari steaks and refrigerate them in the marinade for 1 to 5 hours.

26.text: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to high.

27.text: Drain the calamari in a colander and discard the marinade.

28.text: Lay the steaks on the grill and cook them for 4 to 5 minutes.

29.text: Remove the steaks and drizzle them with extra oil, lemon juice, and salt.
